frameDefinitions: The size of an Entity is assessed in terms of the Degree by which it deviates from the norm.
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals.
An Experiencer has an easy or difficult time carrying out an Activity.
An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled_situation.
A generally large group of people, the Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted Fight amongst themselves.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
frameExamples: He found them in the <t>deluge</t> of papers on his desk.
Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
listRoleDefinitions: The thing whose size is being considered.
The feature of an (actual or possible) <fen>Entity</fen> that is measured. In literal examples, it essentially must be size, or a word equivalent to size such as bulk.
The <fen>Quantity</fen>-denoting <t>Target</t> word.
A substance that is being quantified.
A collection of entities.

This Frame Element marks expressions indicating the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> finds difficult or easy. In many cases, the relevant <fen>Activity</fen> has to be inferred from the context.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate which person judges carrying out the <fen>Activity</fen> to be easy or difficult.
The time at which the <fen>Activity</fen> takes place.
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the <fen>Item</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged.
The <fen>Combatants</fen> participate as fighters in the <fen>Fight</fen>.
The violent activity.
When the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
Where the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
listRoleExamples: The particles were smaller <fex>in size</fex> than expected .
A modicum <fex>of seepage on the floor</fex> is to be expected.
A number <fex>of concerned citizens</fex> have raised objections.
The geology question on the exam was hard <fex>for me</fex>.
It was <fex>hot</fex> enough to ignite the iron.
Can He make a rock too heavy <fex>for Him to lift</fex>?
The football referee's controversial call led to a bloody free-for-all <fex>among the fans</fex>.
I couldn't help but watch as several bruised people reentered the <fex><t>melee</t></fex>.
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: two and a half square miles
